author: nordbjerg
content:
in order to compute the hash of the genesis block if prague is active at genesis, you need to set the requests hash to something. there are no actual requests at genesis, so you'd fill it with `EMPTY_REQUESTS_HASH`

it's just an implementation detail

author: tersec
content: Each genesis block is different in many ways regardless; these requests are just one part of that

author: nordbjerg
content: yeah it was an implementation question, not something that would be in the eip. we have the same type of constants for empty trie root, empty keccak hash etc

author: nordbjerg
content: to avoid going through the hasher or trie algo if we're doing nothing

author: m.kalinin
content: for the generic empty requests hash we would need something like MPT where the shape of empty tree doesn't depend on the content's layout

author: tersec
content: Well, what I'm more broadly getting at is whether it's worth compromising the rest of the design around this

author: .fjl
content: I'm going to make a proposal for this

author: .fjl
content: I think it's worth changing the commitment slightly so that an empty contract output is removed from the list completely.

author: .fjl
content: Note this also means we put the prefix byte back into the list on the engine API

author: .fjl
content: It's good to have an empty hash that is not fork-dependent.
